title: Blackletter specimen for "embroiderers"
content:
"Alphabets for embroiderers"  
The next blackletter specimen thing (around 1900) from the romibello.de flickr account (Robert Michael), you would have certainly missed :)

An appetizer  
 [152\_5265](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317094707/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/romibello/407000251/)  
more of them  
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/romibello](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317094707/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/romibello)
author: poms

comments.content:
Hey, it would be fun to design a bitmappy blackletter font that references this stuff, although I assume that it's already been done

--N

Indeed it has: [http://www.fontshop.de/newsfeed/files/a7e17e10d437c2b791512937aace86b2-2...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317094707/http:/www.fontshop.de/newsfeed/files/a7e17e10d437c2b791512937aace86b2-21.html "http://www.fontshop.de/newsfeed/files/a7e17e10d437c2b791512937aace86b2-21.html")

Mayber there is still room for a cross-stitch blackletter, though.
